description_txt: stated on March 28, 2017 in a letter:
quote_txt: Says there is a "traditional 60-vote threshold for confirming Supreme Court nominees."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2017 in in a State Impact article.:
quote_txt: "...the earth moves closer to the sun every year – you know the rotation of the earth. We’re moving closer to the sun."

description_txt: stated on March 10, 2017 in an interview:
quote_txt: A study of where teachers apply to work found that "less than 5 percent wanted to work in rural Wisconsin."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2017 in a CNN town hall:
quote_txt: In New York state, "you cannot charge an older person even one dollar more than a younger person" for health insurance.

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2017 in a headline:
quote_txt: "Ken Starr’s plane just disappeared on his way to D.C. to testify against Hillary (Clinton)."

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2017 in an interview on PBS:
quote_txt: "It’s been proven over and over again Medicaid has the worst outcomes in the industrialized world as far as the quality of health care."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "215 members of Congress just voted to let your ISP spy on what type of underwear you buy and sell that data to advertisers."

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2017 in an email newsletter:
quote_txt: "Governor Rauner has called every year for eliminating funding for afterschool programs for at-risk youth, homeless prevention services and programs that help autistic children."

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2017 in a post on a campaign web site:
quote_txt: About a third of Wisconsin’s high schools "are missing the mark of graduating young adults who are college ready," a "pass rate of 66.6%."

description_txt: stated on March 27, 2017 in a press briefing:
quote_txt: "Just last May, the Department of Justice inspector general found that these (‘sanctuary city’) policies also violate federal law."

description_txt: stated on March 21, 2017 in a vote on HB 697:
quote_txt: Says if a Florida bill (HB 697) punishing sanctuary cities becomes law "it will be the only law of its kind in the nation."

description_txt: stated on March 21, 2017 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "Global food demand is expected to increase by 50 to 97 percent by 2050."

description_txt: stated on March 27, 2017 in a Florida House subcommittee hearing:
quote_txt: "As an undocumented immigrant, you do have constitutional rights here in the United States."

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2017 in an interview on Meet the Press:
quote_txt: "2.1 million jobs have been created in the last six or seven years" in California

description_txt: stated on March 9, 2017 in a U.S. Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: Texas "spent close to a third of its budget on Medicaid last year, a third of all state spending."

description_txt: stated on February 2, 2017 in a budget speech at Nixa’s Early Childhood Center:
quote_txt: "K-12 education is getting more money this year than they did last year. ... It is a total increase of 4.1 percent."

description_txt: stated on March 27, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Immigrants are responsible for 96 percent of our small biz growth since 2000."

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2017 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: "In fact, if you add up the net wealth of his cabinet, it has more wealth than a third of the American people total -- close to 100 million people."

description_txt: stated on March 17, 2017 in a Tiger Bay speech:
quote_txt: Says Florida officials amended a contract from Lockheed Martin from 305 promised jobs to six.

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2017 in comments on "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Obamacare "is in a death spiral."

description_txt: stated on February 8, 2017 in a speech:
quote_txt: "Somebody observed this week that you have to go back to the very founding of the government to the first administration of George Washington to find a time when it’s taken longer to put a Cabinet in place."

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2017 in a press conference to repeal the SAFE Act:
quote_txt: "We have counties where there have been one arrest under the SAFE Act. It indicates there's not a whole lot of interest in enforcing this in our upstate counties."

description_txt: stated on March 22, 2017 in In a tweet:
quote_txt: "We offer a tremendous amount of low calorie, no calorie options, like waters, unsweetened products, low calorie diet items. All of which unfortunately are taxed by this tax."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2017 in remarks on the House floor:
quote_txt: "More than half of Planned Parenthood facilities are in rural or medically underserved areas."

description_txt: stated on March 22, 2017 in a report from his Congressional office:
quote_txt: "Under the Republican health care repeal proposal North Carolina faces the 2nd highest premium increase in the nation. North Carolina residents will face an average cost increase of over $7,500."

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2017 in remarks at a Kentucky rally:
quote_txt: "Since China joined — that’s another beauty — the WTO in 2001, the U.S. has lost many more than 60,000 factories."

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2017 in a campaign blog post:
quote_txt: "Our minority graduation rate went from levels below Milwaukee and Madison, to above 80%" when I was Beloit school superintendent.

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2017 in a statement on the 7th anniversary of the Affordable Care Act:
quote_txt: "The vast majority of marketplace enrollees have experienced no average premium hike at all."
